intro: Actinodaphne setchuenensis, commonly known as the Sichuan laurel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to China, particularly the Sichuan province, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, and it produces dark, glossy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. The botanical features of Actinodaphne setchuenensis make it a valuable component of its native ecosystems.
